Where does she take you?
12122211121122222222122111211212212.title: Saved at last, or are you?

121222111211222222221221112112122121.content:
This is not good, you think to yourself. Most of this school hates me! Any friends of hers aren't going to be friends of mine. Well, they might hate me but they aren't crazy. They're not going to kill me...are they?

You heard lots of sounds. She was in the hall. You were terrified. You had no idea where she was taking you. You had to find out where she was going in case you get a chance to escape; that way, you would know where you were and where to go next. You decided to climb up the side of her purse. You climbed onto her red nail-polish using her compact mirror and lipstick tube. When you couldn't reach the top from here, you climbed up to the top using the fabric lining of the purse. You reached the top and peered out, slipping through a hole on one side of the single snap button. Every step she took, shook her purse and you along with it. In order to keep from falling, you threw your arms over the side to secure yourself. you then took your look around.

You saw that she was still in the hallway. But you hadn't been on this hallway. You didn't know where you were!!! That is until you heard the sounds of the other students grow larger. You looked around and saw that she was close to the cafeteria. Yes, you knew where you could go from here; granted that you don't get caught or stepped on. Either would be bad, and most likely intentional; you overheard a few complaining about the game and how without Craig, they were sure to loose. They were speaking very angry words concerning you.

You were so glad that no one could see you. Everyone was moving by so fast that no one would take notice of some teen girl's purse. However, as she passed by the last of the lockers on her way to her destination. You spotted something that seemed to stand out. It was a teenage boy, about seventeen or eighteen years old. He had brown hair, a thin layer of facial hair, and wore rectangular glasses with red rims wrapping around the glass. He wore blue jeans and a gray shirt. Over his shirt he wore a black blazer and a black fedora on his head. A typical teenager from the description but he had two very peculiar features; hanging from his left arm was a cane - the handle wrapped around his elbow. The other feature was that his right hand held a match that he was using to light a tobacco pipe in his left hand. He lit it and doused the match. From out of his mouth came puffs of smoke afterward.

You don't know what, but something about him drew your eyes. You didn't take them away from him the entire time. Then as she passed by the boy, he exhaled another cloud of smoke from his mouth, you saw his hazel eyes pierce through the smog and stare strait at you. You weren't sure of it though, but when the girl completely walked away, you saw him turn his neck to watch her go. You never took your eyes away from him, until you hear your captive talking with another girl. You then see her reaching for her purse. You quickly withdraw your arms and allow yourself to fall back into your leather prison. You look up expecting to see the button open up and a hand to descend on you, but you don't see anything. She must have been going for something on one of the side pouches of the purse.

You soon felt her moving again. Every step she took brought her closer to her destination. You had to get out now! You started to climb up when you heard most of the noises stop. You then heard her say, “Guess who I’ve got?” You were dead for sure. Suddenly you felt your entire world shake around. You assumed that she was shaking her purse. After you had been shaken up, you saw a bright light pour inside. You covered your eyes when you saw the shadow of a hand descend on you. It wrapped around you and lifted you out of the purse.

The light was so bright, it was unbearable, but eventually your eyes adjusted. You looked around and saw grass, a tree and the blue sky; you were outside! You saw a few picnic benches and heard the sounds of a few kids; she’d taken you to the outside lunch area. However, she’d brought you around a corner of a brick wall away from the other tables, so no one could see her or her friends. You gulped with fear.

“Well, well, well,” said a male voice. It was familiar enough to make your eyes shoot open with fear. She did NOT bring you to him! He was definitely the last person you wanted to see. You slowly began to turn around and see Craig Bradley sitting on the table and his two cronies standing beside. “If it isn’t the little bug that got us kicked out of school boys.”

“Craig, I never said anything about you guys,” you said choking on fear. The boys just glared and started cracking their knuckles. You turned to look up at the girl and asked, “Why would you bring me to him? I thought you and Elissa hated this guy?!”

“Now why would I hate my new honey?” she said. “I was always jealous that Elissa got all the attention as well as the hottest guy in school. But, Craig’s with me now, and I’d do anything for my new boyfriend.”

“Thanks babe,” Craig said snapping his fingers and pointing at her. She giggled a bit. Craig continued smiling evilly at you. “Word around here is that you’re public enemy number one. Not surprising seeing as how you steal the star player’s girl, get him kicked out of school and then ruined the school’s chances of winning the State Championship. Who couldn’t hate you?”

“Who couldn’t hate me?” you ask. “Stole your girl? Craig, you almost killed me! I had two broken ribs and a medley of contusions because of you, you Psycho! You walk around like a King and you were a jerk to everyone around here. Then I show up and you try and kill me on my first day. You get kicked out of school, and now everyone reveres you like some kind of god? You tried to kill me!”

Craig started laughing. “Oh look boys, the insect thinks he’s a human being.” The boys began laughing as well as the girl. Your mind sunk in as you heard those words. “Let me explain this to you bug; we as well as most of the world, are human beings. You don’t fit the requirements. You fit the qualifications for an insect or something. And as such, you don’t get the usual rights that we humans do. And we humans, we have a habit of squashing little pests like you.”

“Do you hear yourself?!” you yell out unable to contain your anger any longer. “You think that I’m not human because of my size. And now you suddenly think that gives you the right to kill me? That his a load of crap. And once my lawyer gets a-hold of you, you’ll be in jail faster than you can kick a football, you Psycho!”

“And if you were to suddenly disappear? How long would it be for people to forget you? We crush your kind everyday. Plus, when they do look for you, the one’s they’ll blame are that teacher.” Mrs. Andrews, you thought. “And that foreign freak – what’s his name – Pepe’ Le Pieu!”

“His name is Pierre!!!” you yelled against your better instincts. Craig turned to his boys.

“I’m tired of hearing this bug talk,” he said. “What do you say we show him what I’m best at?” He turned towards the girl. She suddenly started handing you off to one of the boys. You saw Craig taking steps back.

“WHAT ARE YOU DOING?” you yell as the big teenager puts you on the ground and holds your head between his thumb and index finger.

"There's a reason why I was needed to win the game, Cockroach," he said. "What was it you said? I'd be in jail faster than I can kick a football? Well...let's see just how fast that really is!!!"

Your eyes opened wide when you realized what that meant. You then saw Craig start his run.

What happens now?
121222111211222222221221112112122121.title: This is very, very, VERY BAD!!!

1212221112112222222212211121121221211.content:
You screamed for help all you could, but it did no good. The other students were too far away to hear your little voice. Everything went slow as you saw Craig running towards you. You tried to struggle, but because your head was pinched in between the jock's two fingers. There was no escape.

"1!" He yelled. You knew why. He was counting down. "2!" He was only a few feet away when you saw his right leg start to go back in its arch. You went silent. "3!!!" You knew what was coming now. You saw the foot begin to swing back towards you. You couldn't take your eyes off it. You couldn't yell for help, you couldn't escape, you couldn't do anything. All you could do, was hope that it would be quick and painless. "PUNT-dah!!!"

You snapped out of your fear and saw that Craig had stopped. His leg remained back in its arch, trying to pull forward. But something had stopped it. You looked up and saw a figure standing behind Craig. But you couldn't recognize who it was. But you looked back down toward the leg that was about to kick you into next week. You saw something wrapped around his ankle. It was the tip of a cane!!!

Craig turned his head around. His friends looked up and saw the teenage boy from the hall. He was holding the cane that held Craig's leg back. He was glaring at them with his piercing hazel eyes. Other than that, he said nothing.

"What the f-HEY!" before Craig could finish, the boy raised his arm, pulling the cane up. The movement pulled Craig into the air and the handle came off his ankle. The boy then slammed the cane down on Craig's back making him impact back onto the ground. Craig groaned in pain and didn't get up. The boy then stood up right and let the cane rest at his side. It was so fast that you barely saw it. You were astounded. The jock pinching your head let go allowing you to fall onto your back. He got up and rushed toward the intruder with a fist held high.

"Who do you think you are, punk?" he was about to throw a the punch. Suddenly the boy thrust the cane into the jock's stomach, causing him to bend over in pain. The boy then grabbed the handle of the cane and pulled back on it, swinging the end of the cane into the jock's face. The jock shot up because of the impact and stared at the sky. The boy then twirled his cane around until the pole rested on the back of the jock's head. He pulled back on the cane pulling the jock with him, throwing the jock to the ground behind him. He landed next to Craig and didn't get up either. The boy then started walking toward you.

The third boy stood up on top of the table and then jumped, trying to tackle the mystery boy. However, your defender sidestepped out of the way allowing the jock to pass. However as he passed, the boy moved his cane onto the jock's pants. It hooked onto either his pockets, his belt or his belt loop; regardless, the cane hooked onto his pants. The mysterious warrior then began spinning, pulling the boy with it. Then, the cane unhooked the jock's pants and sent him flying toward the brick wall. He hit hard, but he wasn't knocked out. He was angry now and rushed toward his opponent throwing a punch. However, the other boy began to twirl his cane. The cane pressed against the lunging arm and forced it to follow the spin. The boy then stepped behind the jock's back, still leading his arm. He pressed the cane against the jock's back, pinning his arm there as well. The boy lifted his leg up and placed his foot on the jock's back. He kicked, pushing the jock forward. He slipped the cane out from under the jock's arm and then slashed the cane across his opponent's rear end. The jock straitened out and put his hands over his buttocks in pain before falling on top of the other boy.

You were astounded. You'd only seen things like this in movies, never in real life; of course you'd only seen people being shrunken down to minuscule sizes in movies, but look how your life turned out. But still everything that this boy did was amazing! He looked to be about an average teenage size without large muscles, but he just beat up the three largest boys in school. And he did it all for you! And you don't even know who he is!!! You looked up and saw the girl was up against the wall completely terrified. Now the question is...how would you react to him?

"You, Bradley," he said pointing his cane down toward Craig's head. Craig groaned as he looked up he slowly pulled himself to his feet. You got a chance to compare the two. They were almost the same height, but Craig was definitely taller. And what was worse, his muscles were huge compared to this boy's arms. And he was angry.

"You, you're gonna pay for that you little punk!" he said huffing.

"Sure," the boy said condescendingly. "Because the Big can always outdo the Small. They have power over those who are smaller and weaker than them and can do anything they want to them. You know all about that don't you? You tried to exercise it on the kid over there," he said nodding his head toward you. "That's how it's gotten to be for bullies like you. You always prey upon someone smaller and weaker than you. He is the perfect target; definitively smaller and weaker. And somehow by killing him, no one will ever question your power again. Is that how it goes...you ignorant psychopathic Meat-head?"

What does Craig do?
1212221112112222222212211121121221211.title: Unexpected Hero

12122211121122222222122111211212212111.content:
"SHUT UP!!!" Craig yelled. Apparently, insulting his intelligence is a pressure point. He threw a punch toward the boy's face. The boy's expression didn't change. He leaned to the side, completely dodging the attack. Craig threw another punch with his other arm - it was easily dodged. He threw another and another and another - all of them dodged. Craig was getting irritated, his teeth gritted. He threw the hardest punch he could. The boy still had no reaction and this time, he didn't even try to dodge. Instead, Craig's fist was suddenly caught by the boy's hand.

Craig was still trying to force forward, you could tell by the way it was shivering. But the boy's hand and arm was completely still. You saw him slightly turn Craig's wrist and then he began to push his hand back farther than his joint would allow. Suddenly, you heard a cracking sound. You saw Craig's eyes get wider. He then tried to pull away, but the boy wouldn't let go. He was tightening his grip on Craig's fist. You heard another crack. You then heard Craig scream in pain as he dropped down to one knee. He put his free hand on his wrist to try and pull away. He grabbed at the boy's hands to try and get free. "Let go!!!" The boy tightened harder causing Craig to drop onto both knees, using his free hand to keep himself up.

"Now this is interesting," the boy began. "Here I am, with a boy who is at the very least twice my size, twice my physical strength and I have him...on his knees...bowing to me. But wait! This can't be right! It goes against the laws of the Universe! The Large are better than the Small! You exercise it on him a lot." Craig kept grunting and trying to pull away. He gritted his teeth and stared at the boy angrily and wild eyed. The boy raised an eyebrow and then smiled darkly. "You know what? You're right; it's not really bowing until your face hits the ground!" You suddenly heard a loud popping sound and Craig yelled louder. His head hung from his shoulders.

"P-p-please, l-l-let go," he said calmly between gasps of pain. You never thought you'd see Craig like this. You looked up at the teenage boy and your mind kept wondering how it was possible.

"Hm...Begging for Mercy," the boy said. "Alright close enough!" Suddenly the boy let go of Craig's hand. Craig pulled his arm back and flew backwards. His friends had long since gotten up and were astonished seeing their ringleader like this. They rushed toward him and pulled him to his feet. But he pushed away from them. He stood up and raised a fist.

"You're going to pay for this! I'm going to sue your clothes off and then I'm going to sew your ass to your face!"

"No you're not," the boy said smiling. "You're not going to be able to. How are you going to prove that a kid like me did that to your hand? He's your only witness. Now stop being a big baby; you're hand is going to be fine in a couple of days. You've got bigger things to worry about. So I suggest not building up more debt and burying yourself in even more shit. Seeing as your going to be brought up on two charges of assault and attempted murder." Craig and his friends raised an eyebrow to that. "Faces and Names, Craig; I've got 'em. Now I think you guys should go work on your alibis."

Craig was angry now. "Well it doesn't matter anyway. The bug doesn't matter anymore; I'll always be greater than him! I've got a dozen offers from the Top Universities already. I don't need to win the championship here. Screw this school! I'm still going to go on to be a professional football player."

"Top Universities? Football Scholarships?" The boy chuckled softly. He closed his eyes and began swaying his head. "Craig, don't you get it? None of that is going to happen. The minute you first kicked that boy across the hall, your life was officially over. The kid said you were going to jail; that's not even a fraction of what's going to happen to you. Once his family is done suing you, you - and probably your entire family - are going to have to work for the rest of your life to pay him off...not to mention all the legal fees. Last week, those universities were going to offer you the world. Now that you've got a record, they wouldn't even touch you with a forty foot cattle-prod. Oh, and you will be imprisoned; maybe for life. And even if you do get out, you'll still be in prison; a prison for your relationships, a prison for your money, and most importantly, a prison for your life. And believe me, I know about prisons. The point now is, you made your choice and now it's come back to bite you in the ass! Your future...has gone bye-bye."

Craig stood there, completely stunned as well as his two boys. So were you. Craig just got schooled in the legal future that awaits him. He was going to spend his entire life paying you money; and you loved it! The jerk had finally been put in his place! You, your mother, and your sister were set for life!!!

"Now get out of here," he said. "Since you've been expelled, just being here can add Trespassing onto your list of charges."

"Oh, so what are you going to do about that?" Craig asked as his buddies stepped forward.

"Oh, I'm not going to do anything." The boy then lifted his left arm and looked at his watch. "The solution should present itself in - 5...4...Here...We...Go!"

At that moment, the policeman who served as the school's security guard was leaving the school with a box of donuts. He was going on his lunch break and had just exited the school. That's when he turned and saw Craig. He recognized him and his boys from when Mr. Ripley called them up to the office to be expelled. "Hey you!!!" he called starting to run over to them.

"Crap! Scram boys!!!" Craig said as the three of them began to run away. The cop began to chase them.

"Oh look, another witness!" the boy called when the cop ran past him. "Be sure to testify about what they've done here today!!!" The boy smiled confidently. But he didn't see the girl walk up to him. She tried to slap him in the face, but he lifted a hand and caught her arm.

"You jerk," she said. "That was my boyfriend you attacked! And if he can't sue you, then I will!"

He suddenly pushed her against the wall and held her there as he said, "Firstly; that wasn't assault, that was defense. And secondly; you won't be able to sue either, cause you'll be too busy being sued as well." Her eyes widened. "I'm pretty sure that Mrs. Letellier wouldn't appreciate the fact that you kidnapped her son, kept him in your gym sock during Gym Class and then finally turning him over to a group of individuals with the intent of killing him with a record of doing just that...But I know her lawyer would." He then leaned in close to her face and said, "Now run little rabbit...run!"

He released her from the wall and she scampered off toward the building and went inside. You couldn't believe what had happened, a few minutes ago you were sure you were going to die. Then this kid comes out of here like some Heroic Warrior sent to save you. But then he started walking towards you. You seemed to snap out of your world of admiration and saw this kid for what he is; a teenager. And the majority of teenagers that you know hate your guts. What if he was one of those that hated you because of the game? What if he only saved you so he could have the chance to get back at you? I mean, if someone could, who wouldn't beat up Craig for no reason?

He was about a foot from you now. You stared up at the giant teen. He was giving you one of his blank expressions again. You couldn't tell what he was thinking. You were terrified. Suddenly, you saw him swing the handle of the cane down toward you! You were right; he does hate you!!! The cane was certainly going to crush you. You closed your eyes and covered your head with your arms. You waited for the inevitable impact. You hoped it would be painless.

What happens now?
12122211121122222222122111211212212111.title: Craig's Future

choices: NO ONE WAS HOLDING THE CANE!!!
Someone else was holding the cane. (as if)
121222111211222222221221112112122121111.content:
You felt the breeze of the wind the cane pushed down blow over you. But you didn't feel the pain of the impact. It never came. You slowly crack both your eyes open and you saw the handle of the cane hovering just above you. It just stayed there within reach of your body. You looked up and saw the boy giving you a light expression. Something that you'd call a 'neutral smile'.

"Well c'mon," he said. "Grab a-hold!" You looked at the cane. You didn't fully trust this guy yet. You didn't know him. But, he did rescue you. You reached up and grabbed onto the curve of the handle. You wrapped both arms tightly around the wooden handle. He smiled again. "Good, now hold on tight." Suddenly you felt him turning the cane to where the handle was pointing toward the sky. You held on with all your might, but you were afraid that your arms would give out at any moment. You wrapped your legs around the handle as well to be as secure as possible. Then once the rotating had stopped, you shimmied up the slope of the handle until you reached the partially flat top. There, you let your body lay against it. You turned your head to look back at him. "You okay, kid?" he asked you. You slowly nodded your head while your mouth was still a gaped. You stared at him, still fearful. "Good," he said. Before long you felt the cane moving as he began to walk. You quickly wrapped your limbs around the cane again, However, you begin to notice that he's keeping the cane rather steady, it's not rocking about at all. You relaxed a bit.

He crossed the outdoor picnic area and went toward the double doors that led back into the building. He opened one and stepped inside. It was quiet and empty. The lunch periods were over and everyone was back in class. You thought it was a bad thing; you didn't know where this guy was taking you and if he were to turn on you at any minute, there'd be no one around to help you. Though, not many would, but you were hoping you'd be lucky enough to have a teacher walk by. But there was no one. And this was a person who could easily kill you; no...he could kill people like Craig and his goons. He could completely destroy you...And you were completely at his mercy.

"Alright Mark," he said. "The silence is getting a bit irritating. I know you have a lot of questions, so I say, let's be on with it..."

"You know my name?" you say. But then realize how ridiculous it was to. There probably wasn't anyone in the building that didn't know you.

"I sure do," he said. "And no, I don't know you because of you getting Craig expelled and ruining the game and blah-blah-blah. I'm not part of the majority that hates you and I don't plan on being such. Any other questions?"

Your next question was the obvious one. "Who...Who are you?"

"Name's Sean," he said. "Just Sean."

"Well Sean...um...why would you save me?" you asked next.

"Why wouldn't I save you?"

"Well, like you said, the majority of the school hates me. How come you don't?"

"Well, like I also said, 'Blah-Blah-Blah'. The reason you're hated is a stupid one. They hate you cause you almost got killed, got the assailant kicked out of school and now they won't win their precious Championship Football game. Sports don't matter to me; they seem so trivial. And they're certainly not something to hate someone over. You can relax Mark. Believe me, if I had wanted to hurt you, I'd have done it by now."

That made you feel better...or maybe not. Actually it made you feel a little less than better. But, he so far showed no malicious intent toward you. You began to relax a little bit. You decided to get a little more comfortable. You pulled your leg over the other side of the cane and let it dangle down next to your other leg. You sat up strait now. You then asked, "But why did you save me?"

He looked over and smiled, "Cause I like you kid. You interest me...You...intrigue me."

He sounded a bit creepy when he said that. You don't know what possessed you to ask, "Whyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy?"

"Tell them that it's Human Nature," he said. After he said it, he started chuckling to himself. You didn't get the joke. He stopped after a short while. "Sorry, it's the line of a song that I like. As for why you interest me...well, its your size - I hope you don't take offense at that. But - its at least got to do with your size. You see, no one in the world is like you. Now you'd think that with someone of your stature, people would treat you kindly as such a delicate thing. The interesting thing is, because of a circumstance that you have no control over, everyone in this school hates you."

You let your head drop as you realized how right he was.

"I guess it ISN'T Human Nature but to be kind and compassionate," he started again. "But instead to take advantage of those smaller and weaker than themselves. That Psychopath Craig genuinely believes that you are an insect, that deserves to be squashed. Now, one way or another, even though he's been expelled, I have a feeling his influence is going to spread around to the others. It starts out with intimidation; fear. That kid, Pierre. He wants to be friends with you, but he's afraid to be due to the threat of alienation. And what's more, they'll probably beat him up and get away with it, considering that few people here are willing to rat on each other, and how they're all working for the same cause. Eventually, I have a feeling that the people here are going to get very violent towards you. And the way things are now...You're very vulnerable."

What he was saying made you even sadder. Maybe you should've listened to your mom and left school.

"But all that's about to change." He said. "Now that I'm around, no one's going to have the gall to hurt you ever again; cause if they try - well...I don't need to tell you what'll happen seeing as how you watched me lay up Craig and his goons. Believe me kid, stick by me, and you'll be just fine."

"Um, while we're on the subject," you said springing up. His words slightly made you feel good. But when he started talking about what he did to Craig, you had to take the opportunity while you could. The next question you asked was something you desperately wanted to know. "How exactly did you do that? I mean, Craig and his goons are the three strongest guys in school. You can't weigh more than 140 pounds! Yet you completely wiped them out without even breaking a sweat. What you did seemed completely impossible."

Sean smiled smugly and then chuckled. He lifted his hand up to examine his nails. "Mark, as you'll soon learn, I am adept at many abilities that most human beings consider to be impossible."

You got curious again, albeit a bit nervously. "What do you mean by 'abilities'...and many?"

He chuckled and turned an eye to you and said, "Mark, at what point do you plan on realizing that I'm no longer holding the cane?"

That's when the realization came to you, the hand he was looking at was his right hand. And the cane was on his right side!!! Your eyes got wide. You looked down and saw...
121222111211222222221221112112122121111.title: He's Nice

choices: Your Sister arrives and then your Mom shortly afterwards.
1212221112112222222212211121121221211111.content:
No one was holding the cane!!! The pole was just floating in the air. And it was keeping in pace with Sean as he walked. You shot strait up onto your feet and stood up strait on the cane in complete surprise. You started stuttering. But you couldn't form words no matter what you did; you were at a loss for words.

"Pretty impressive, ain't it?" Sean said looking at you again. You stared at him completely bewildered.

"How are you doing that?" you ask in bewilderment.

"Oh it's just a simple trick," he said. "It's one of the easiest things I've ever done."

"What is it, eh?" you ask. "You got, invisible wires strung up around here to hold it up?"

"Mark at what point do you plan on realizing that you're no longer standing on the cane?" he said as you saw him twirling the cane in his left hand. It's when you realized that he had swung the cane out from under you with his right and had twirled it around into his left, where he kept twirling it. Your eyes nearly jumped from your skull. That's when you looked down. YOU WEREN'T STANDING ON ANYTHING!!!

"Now tell me Mark," he began. "Are there any wires attached to you?"

"DAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!" you yelled. You began flailing your arms trying to grab hold of anything that you could. But you couldn't you seemed to be frozen in the air.

"Relax Mark," he said. "I've got you."

You looked bewildered at him. "You really are doing this?"

"You bet your life I am," he said. "As long as I retain my focus, you won't go any higher or lower than that spot."

You began to calm a little bit. You began to start moving your arms around like you were swimming, giving yourself a little propulsion forward. You couldn't believe it, you were flying! And no one else was going to believe it, cause there was no one around to see you, not even a janitor. But it was fun. You smiled and laughed a bit.

It wasn't long before you realized where Sean was taking you. It wasn't back to any class, it was to the front office. You figured that if you explained what happened to you, you wouldn't get in trouble for missing your classes. Sean had reached the door to the office when you stopped him.

"Wait Sean!" you called. He turned. "Everything; taking on Craig, levitating the cane, making me fly...how did you do it?" He scoffed for a minute before looking at me with a truly happy expression.

"Magic," he said.

Your eyes got wide again. You couldn't believe anymore. "What?!" you yelled.

He leaned in forward with a finger over his lips. "Shhhhhhh." He then pulled back and winked at you. When he did, you thought you saw a strange sparkly light shoot out the corner of his eye. He then lifted his cane from underneath you allowing you to land your feet on it. He then opened the door and went into the office. You were quiet for a while. Sean entered the office and saw the woman sitting at the front near the intercom, reading a book. She looked up and saw Sean.

"Sean," she said. "What are you doing here?"

"Hello Dorris," he said working around her desk. "Don't worry," he said, pulling the intercom's microphone away from her and placing it closer to himself. "Just here to make a special announcement." He then lowered his cane onto the counter so you could walk off. He then pressed the button and the intercom buzzed to life with a 'BEEP' and then a 'BOOM'. He spoke into the microphone, "Would a Miss Julie Letellier please come to the front office?" However, Sean also pressed down the receiving button. From all over the school came a series of 'boos' and 'hisses' and 'insults'. You felt bad about how because of you, Julie's reputation was also ruined. Sean however pressed the intercom again and yelled, "Shut the hell up!!!" That suddenly got everyone quiet. No one had ever said something like that over the intercom. Just imagining the looks on their faces made you smile.

Suddenly Mr. Ripley stormed out of his office and said, "Mrs. Sanders, who was it that just made that announcement over the intercom?" Dorris didn't have a chance to say anything. Ripley saw Sean standing next to the intercom. He rushed toward him pointing his index finger. "Young man, that intercom is school property and is not for student use, and what you just said over it is grounds for suspens-"

"Nice to meet you too Mr. Ripley," Sean said suddenly seizing Mr. Ripley's hand forcing, his pointing finger into an open handshake. "My name is Sean - nevermind the last name - I'm a new student here." Mr. Ripley was suddenly speechless as Sean shook his hand. "You'll have to forgive the obscenity, Sir. I was just silencing the student's deplorable behavior as you have very well have heard yourself. And you certainly know why. I was merely helping out the fugitive here."

That's when Ripley looked down and saw you standing there. "I understand. They been giving you trouble again, Mark?"

"Oh it's much worse than that, sir," you said. But then you silently cursed yourself for doing so. You hated ratting on people and now you might've just put yourself in a position that you can't back away from.

"What do you mean son?" Ripley asked. You looked up at him and were about to come up with some excuse, when suddenly the security guard entered. It was the same cop that chased off Craig an his goons.

"Mr. Ripley," he said. "That Bradley boy and his two friends were here."

"What?!" Ripley said. He then looked down at you. His expression seemed to say that he'd pieced the puzzle together. "Have you called the police?" The cop nodded. He explained that they were going to be scouring the county on a man-hunt for Craig. Mr. Ripley looked at you again and asked, "You alright Mark?"

"I'm a bit shaken up, my body aches a bit, my head hurts a little, but other than that, I'm fine," you say. "Thanks to Sean here."

The cop looked up and recognized Sean. "Yeah, you were there when they ran away. What were you doing?"

"First off," Sean started. "I want it on the record, that whatever I did was strictly in defense of Mark."

"I can vouch for that." you said. "He showed up from out of nowhere and he saved me. I really don't want to say this, but if it hadn't been for Sean, I'd be in worse condition than I was when Craig first attacked me."

"Well...uh," Ripley looked at Sean with a bit of confusion for a moment. "Well, the boy is a hero then; well done."

"Well thank you, sir," Sean said. "Well, as you've heard from the intercom, I've called the boy's sister up. I suggest calling his mom next."

"R-right," Mr. Ripley said. Something about it seemed weird that he would so easily take the suggestion of a teenage boy. It was almost like he was following an order. He spun around to look at Dorris and said, "Get the boy's mother on the phone." Dorris began dialing. "Now, I suggest that whatever is said in this office stays in this office. This incident is NOT to get out to the other students. We don't want any more trouble for Mark."

"Will all due respect sir," Sean began. "It might be too late for that. There was a fourth there; a girl still enrolled here. Apparently she's dating Craig now; she hand-delivered Mark to him. There's a chance that she's spreading rumors around to further bash Mark's reputation. However, I have a feeling that she might be wiser and keep quiet, because any information about what she did leaks out could cause trouble for her; plus if she does tell them anything, Mrs. Letellier can sue her for wrongful prosecution."

Ripley was stunned for a minute. So was I. How did Sean no so much about legality? "Well, Sean," Mr. Ripley began. "We have to ask that you stay in the office so that way we can get the information about the situation; we'd like to wait until Mrs. Letellier gets here."

"I'm perfectly alright with that," Sean said. "I wasn't planning on being anywhere anyway." He then lowered his hand down to you. You immediately hopped on, feeling perfectly safe in Sean's hand. He carried you over to the waiting chairs and placed you on the small table next to them. He sat down in one. "I know you don't like 'squealing' Mark, but believe you me; in this situation, it's going to help. When your mom and sister get here, you don't have to hold back. Since Craig is now outside the school's system, I highly doubt it's going to get you in much trouble here. Besides, I'm pretty sure making that kid go behind bars where he belongs will be a real treat. There's no way we can loose. Just wait and see what happens." Sean finished talking and adjusted himself in the seat, and pulled out his pipe again. He merely stuck it between his teeth without lighting it. The things he said really did make you feel good. You decided that you were done playing nice. It was time to make sure that Craig got what was coming to him.

"Sean," you said. He turned his head slightly to look at you. "Thank you...for saving my life."
